pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
I guess from my personal view, I genuinely don't understand the motive behind not using `Get` (at best, you save yourself from typing three letters) while I see numerous disadvantages to it, including (but not limited to)

1. Awkward semantics: Function names end up being nouns, even though they're performing a task by retrieving a resource.

2. Naming imbalance: Here we have `GetInterface` and `HasInterface`, but we would end up with `Interface` and `HasInterface` if we removed `Get`.

3. Lower quality of life for autocomplete users: Many people who use autocomplete like to be able to type `g-e-t-` to preview what kind of parameters they are able to retrieve from an object. Removing `Get` would take that away from them (... and from me). This also applies to anyone who might want to `ctrl-F` or `/get` search the API for getter functions.
